wikipedia_page.main:
Arthur German (28 June 1905 – 2 February 1968) was an English cricketer.  German was a right-handed batsman.  He was born at Ashby-de-la-Zouch, Leicestershire, and was educated at Repton School.
German made his first-class debut for Leicestershire against Sussex at the County Ground, Hove, in the 1923 County Championship.  He made two further first-class appearances for Leicestershire the following season, against Surrey at The Oval, and Essex at Aylestone Road, Leicester.  In his three first-class matches, he scored a total of 73 runs at an average of 12.16, with a high score of 36.He died at Aberdeen, Scotland on 2 February 1968.  His uncle, Harry German, also played first-class cricket for Leicestershire.

response: He died at Charing Cross, London on 14 June 1945.  His nephew, Arthur German, also played first-class cricket for Leicestershire.
